original: de'i phyir rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa ni sems dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par shes par 'dod nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab 'byor gyis gsol pa zhes pa ni sems dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par shes par 'dod nas dris pa'o //
translated: Therefore, Subhūti said, etc. This is the question asked in order to know that the mind is the spiritual friend.

original: chos thams cad dben pa dang stong pa lags na zhes pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang stong pa nyid lags na zhes pa'o//
analyzed: chos thams cad dben pa dang stong pa lags na zhes pa ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang stong pa nyid lags na zhes pa'o//
translated: If all things are void and empty, etc. means if all things are essenceless and empty.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni sems can yang rang bzhin med pa yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa lta ci smos zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa ni sems can yang rang bzhin med pa yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa lta ci smos zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: How can there be the origination of defilement in sentient beings? The idea is that if sentient beings are also without intrinsic nature, what need is there to mention defilement?

original: gal te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ji ltar rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ji ltar rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it has the nature of defilement, how can there be purification,

original: gcig gis gcig @269b spangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig @269b spangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since the one is the negation of the other?

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid kyang ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid kyang ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it unchanging?

original: dben pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dben pa ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur rnam par byang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Isolation is not defiled and is not purified.

original: dben pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis dben pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis dben pa'o //
translated: Isolation is the isolation of all conceptual differentiation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ni rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ni rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: Defilement and purification are conceptual differentiation.

original: rigs kyi bu gnyis su rtog pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gnyis su rtog pa 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Son of noble family, this conceptual differentiation into two is conceptual differentiation.

original: gnyis po 'di ni res 'jog tu rtog kyang rnam par rtog pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di ni res 'jog tu rtog kyang rnam par rtog pa'o zhe'o //
translated: This conceptual differentiation into two is also conceptual differentiation even if it is conceptualized as an alternation.

original: 'o na dben pa dang stong pa nyid de yis gang dag 'tshang rgya'am /
analyzed: 'o na dben pa dang stong pa nyid de yis gang dag 'tshang rgya'am /
translated: Well then, by what is one enlightened, by that emptiness and isolation?

original: de las gzhan zhig gis 'tshang rgya zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan zhig gis 'tshang rgya zhe na /
translated: Or by something else?

original: dben pa'am stong pa nyid kyis 'tshang mi rgya zhes pa ste de nyid kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa'am stong pa nyid kyis 'tshang mi rgya zhes pa ste de nyid kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not by emptiness and isolation that one is enlightened, because it is free from the aspect of that.

original: 'og ma ltar na yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'og ma ltar na yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is it by the other,

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyang yod ba ma yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyang yod ba ma yin la /
translated: because buddhahood does not exist,🔽and causes and conditions do not exist.

original: rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ma yin no zhes dris pa dang lan du rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes pa ni bsam pa ci zhig yod ces pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ma yin no zhes dris pa dang lan du rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems zhes pa ni bsam pa ci zhig yod ces pa ste /
translated: In response to the question, “Subhuti, what do you think? ” means, “What is your opinion? ”

original: bsam pa ni shin tu rigs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa ni shin tu rigs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opinion is very difficult to understand.

original: sems can rnams yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod ces pa ni thog ma med pa nas ngar 'dzin pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'o //🔽nga yir 'dzin pa ni bdag gi pha'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod ces pa ni thog ma med pa nas ngar 'dzin pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'o // nga yir 'dzin pa ni bdag gi pha'o //
translated: “Sentient beings have long been engaged in the apprehension of ‘I’ and ‘mine’ ” means that from beginningless time, the apprehension of ‘I’ is the apprehension of self.

original: bdag gi ma'o zhes 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi ma'o zhes 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The apprehension of ‘mine’ is the apprehension of ‘my father’,🔽‘my mother’, and so on.

original: de bzhin no zhes pa ni de lta bu yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin no zhes pa ni de lta bu yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus means in that way.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin ba de nyid 'o na yod pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin ba de nyid 'o na yod pa zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Is that grasping at 'I' and grasping at 'mine' real?

original: 'on kyang ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa stong pa yin mod ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa stong pa yin mod ces pa ste /
translated: it is said, Indeed, grasping at 'I' and grasping at 'mine' are empty.

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pas stobs nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad bdag tu 'dzin pa dang bdag gir 'dzin pas stobs nyid do zhe'o //
translated: In the ultimate sense, all phenomena are empty of grasping at 'I' and grasping at 'mine.'

original: 'o na 'khor ba'i rgyu yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'khor ba'i rgyu yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, What is the cause of cyclic existence?

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pas sems can rnams 'khor ba na 'khor ram zhes pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas sems can rnams bcings te 'khor bar 'khyams pa ni 'khor ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pas sems can rnams 'khor ba na 'khor ram zhes pa ni bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pas sems can rnams bcings te 'khor bar 'khyams pa ni 'khor ro zhes pa'o //
translated: it is said, Sentient beings revolve in cyclic existence due to grasping at 'I' and grasping at 'mine.' That is, sentient beings are bound by grasping at 'I' and grasping at 'mine,' and wander in cyclic existence.

original: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa 'di gang zhig yin snyam pa dang / gang las shes snyam pa la las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes pa 'di gang zhig yin snyam pa dang / gang las shes snyam pa la las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Sutra of the Complete Purification of All Karmic Obstructions is mentioned, and so forth.

original: ci skye ba med pa /
analyzed: ci skye ba med pa /
translated: Is it non-arising?

original: skye ba'am zhes pa ni sems nyid skye ba med par gnas pa de ci skye ba gzhan @270a * //
analyzed: skye ba'am zhes pa ni sems nyid skye ba med par gnas pa de ci skye ba gzhan @270a * //
translated: Arising or? means that mind itself abides in non-arising. Is that arising in another?

original: du skye ba'am zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: du skye ba'am zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That means arising.

original: de ni ma lags so zhes pa ni skye ba med pa skye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ma lags so zhes pa ni skye ba med pa skye ba la sogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That is not so means that non-arising does not become arising, and so forth.

original: mi 'gyur kyang sems can dmyal bar gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'gyur kyang sems can dmyal bar gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if it does not become so, it will become so in the hells.

original: skye ba ma mchis pa nyid kyang ma mchis na zhes pa ni skye ba med pa nyid kyang rnam par dag na zhe'o //
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa nyid kyang ma mchis na zhes pa ni skye ba med pa nyid kyang rnam par dag na zhe'o //
translated: If non-arising itself does not exist means that even non-arising itself is purified.

original: ngan 'gror ma mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes pa ni ngan 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba po yang mi dmigs zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngan 'gror ma mchis par 'gyur ba lta ga la mchis zhes pa ni ngan 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba po yang mi dmigs zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: How could there be no lower realms means that even the lower realms and the one who goes to the lower realms are not observed.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: chos thams cad dge bar gyur na ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad dge bar gyur na ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If all phenomena become virtuous, would one not go to a miserable realm?

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not so.

original: de yang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de yang gang las shes she na /
translated: From what is this known?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod kyi mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod kyi mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Sūtra of the Tathāgata’s Treasury says, “If one has faith in all phenomena, one will not go to a miserable realm.”

original: chos thams cad la ma dad pa med pas mngon par dad cing lhag par mos na zhes pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la ma dad pa med cing le lo dang khong khro ba la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la ma dad pa med pas mngon par dad cing lhag par mos na zhes pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la ma dad pa med cing le lo dang khong khro ba la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Since one has no lack of faith in any phenomenon, one has faith and is devoted. This means that one has no lack of faith in any virtuous phenomenon, in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha, and one has no laziness, anger, and so on.

original: de ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Would one not go to a miserable realm?

original: sems de yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems de yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: That mind also will not go to a miserable realm.

original: ngan 'gro thams cad kyi sa bon gtan nas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gro thams cad kyi sa bon gtan nas spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seeds of all miserable realms have been completely abandoned.

original: sa bon spangs pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon spangs pa nyid kyang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why have the seeds been abandoned?

original: dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because one has virtuous phenomena.

original: 'di ltar dge ba gang na yod pa de na nyon mongs mi 'byung la gang la nyon mongs pa med na de la ngan 'gro med de snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba gang na yod pa de na nyon mongs mi 'byung la gang la nyon mongs pa med na de la ngan 'gro med de snang ba dang mun pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, where there is virtue, afflictions do not occur. Where there are no afflictions, there is no bad rebirth, just as there is no darkness where there is light.

original: dge bas kyang nyon mongs pa spong ba nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge bas kyang nyon mongs pa spong ba nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does virtue eliminate afflictions?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la phung po med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la phung po med do //
translated: Afflictions have no aggregates.

original: gang la phung po med pa de ni mi 'gro ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la phung po med pa de ni mi 'gro ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which has no aggregates is a phenomenon that does not go.

original: 'o na chos kyi sku nyid kyang gang gis thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chos kyi sku nyid kyang gang gis thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the dharma body itself attained?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dben pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par dben pa ni nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The complete absence of all afflictions is freedom from afflictions.

original: bral ba de nyid ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: bral ba de nyid ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: That freedom itself is the dharma body.

original: 'o na 'khor bar ji ltar skye zhe na /🔽rgyu rkyen tshogs pa dang phrad pa las skye //
analyzed: 'o na 'khor bar ji ltar skye zhe na / rgyu rkyen tshogs pa dang phrad pa las skye //
translated: Well then, how does one take birth in cyclic existence?🔽Consciousness arises from the assembly and convergence of causes and conditions.

original: zhes pa ni rgyu dang rgyen tshogs pa dang phrad pa las shes pa skye zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rgyu dang rgyen tshogs pa dang phrad pa las shes pa skye zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that consciousness arises from the assembly and convergence of causes and conditions.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa go rims bzhin no //
translated: Name-and-form, etc., in due order.

original: skye ba de yang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba de yang skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: And that birth is also subject to cessation, because it is momentary.

original: skad cig las mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig las mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not endure beyond a moment.

original: de bas na @270b nyon mongs pa rnams 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas 'di ni 'jig pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: de bas na @270b nyon mongs pa rnams 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas 'di ni 'jig pa'i chos can no //
translated: Therefore, since the afflictions are subject to cessation, this is the truth of cessation.

original: de ltar yang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis ma gsungs so zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyis ma gsungs so zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But the former masters did not teach it in this way.

original: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: slob dpon klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
translated: But it is taught by the master Nagarjuna.

original: klu sgrub nyid tshad ma ma yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: klu sgrub nyid tshad ma ma yin no zhe na ;
translated: Nagarjuna himself is not a valid authority.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar lung bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar lung bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Tathagata has prophesied him.

original: de'i don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of that is easy to understand.

original: de ltar las mtha' rnam par 'byed pa 'di bstan pas ci byed ce na /
analyzed: de ltar las mtha' rnam par 'byed pa 'di bstan pas ci byed ce na /
translated: What is the purpose of teaching this analysis of action?

original: sems can sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho la gnas pa rnams sgrol bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho la gnas pa rnams sgrol bar byed do //
translated: It is to liberate beings who are immersed in the ocean of suffering.

original: lung dang rigs pa dag gis shes pa ni rgyud dang mdo dang mi 'gal ba dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa dang / rang gi dam tshig dang mi 'gal ba 'di nyid kyis mi 'gal bar byas pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa dag gis shes pa ni rgyud dang mdo dang mi 'gal ba dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / grags pa dang / rang gi dam tshig dang mi 'gal ba 'di nyid kyis mi 'gal bar byas pa'o zhe'o //
translated: The knowledge by scripture and reasoning is the non-contradiction with the Tantras and Sutras, and the non-contradiction with direct perception, inference, general consent, and one's own vow.

original: lung gi gsung ba po yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: lung gi gsung ba po yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: And who is the speaker of the scripture?

original: thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The one whose nature is great compassion.

original: de bzhin nyid las thugs rje'i stobs kyis gshegs pa gang yin pa des gsungs she'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las thugs rje'i stobs kyis gshegs pa gang yin pa des gsungs she'o //
translated: The one who has gone forth by the power of compassion from suchness itself is the speaker.

original: de yang gang la gzigs she na /
analyzed: de yang gang la gzigs she na /
translated: And what does he see?

original: sems can sdug bsngal gyi dpal klong du ltung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi chu bos ded cing g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal gyi dpal klong du ltung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi chu bos ded cing g-yengs pa'o //
translated: The sentient beings who have fallen into the abyss of suffering are carried away and tossed about by the river of suffering.

original: skyobs dang dpung gnyen med pa ni mgon dang skyob par byed pa ma mthong ba la gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: skyobs dang dpung gnyen med pa ni mgon dang skyob par byed pa ma mthong ba la gzigs pa'o //
translated: The lack of protector and refuge is the non-perception of a protector and a refuge.

original: gzigs nas ci byed ce na /
analyzed: gzigs nas ci byed ce na /
translated: Having seen that, what does he do?

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku yis so //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i tshul gyis zhes pa ni sgyu ma lta bu'i sku yis so //
translated: The by the method of conventional truth is by the illusion-like body.

original: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pas shes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pa yongs su shes pa'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pas shes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pa yongs su shes pa'o /
translated: Knowledge of the nature of the afflictions is knowledge of the aspects of desire, etc.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyid du spang ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa nyid du spang ba bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: shes nas kyang ci zhig mdzad ce na nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par mdzad pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa bka' stsal zhe'o //
analyzed: shes nas kyang ci zhig mdzad ce na nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par mdzad pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa bka' stsal zhe'o //
translated: Having known, what does it do? It purifies the afflictions, i.e., it teaches the immeasurable means of eliminating the afflictions.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa de nyid la gnas pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa de nyid la gnas pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Does it abide in that very conventional truth?

original: don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par sbyangs nas 'od gsal ba'i ngang la snyoms par zhugs zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pas rnam par sbyangs nas 'od gsal ba'i ngang la snyoms par zhugs zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Having purified it with ultimate truth, it enters into the meditative concentration of the clear light.

original: las kyi mtha' ni las kyi mtha' ste las kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ni las kyi mtha' ste las kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The end of action is the result of action.

original: de rnam par 'byed pa ni gsal bar byed spa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par 'byed pa ni gsal bar byed spa'o //
translated: The analysis of that is the clarification of it.

original: the tshom yang du skye zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom yang du skye zhe na /
translated: What is the doubt that arises?

original: las dge ba ma yin snyam pa dang @271a * //
analyzed: las dge ba ma yin snyam pa dang @271a * //
translated: Is action not virtuous?

translated: It is not even his object, because it is extremely profound.🔽What are the ten stages?

original: chos kyi sprin spyi'i sa bcu ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin spyi'i sa bcu ste /
translated: The stage of the cloud of Dharma is the general stage of the ten.

original: des ni zung du 'jug pa slob pa la gnas zin pas ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni zung du 'jug pa slob pa la gnas zin pas ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the object of one who has already attained the stage of training in the union.

original: 'on gang zhig yin zhe na chos kyi mchog chung du ba ste /
analyzed: 'on gang zhig yin zhe na chos kyi mchog chung du ba ste /
translated: What is it then? It is the lesser supreme mundane quality.

original: de la ma sbyangs pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ma sbyangs pa'i phyir de'i yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of that, because one is not trained in it.

original: 'di la yang ci'i phyir sa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang ci'i phyir sa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called a stage here?

original: brtan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a support,

original: 'di la brten nas gong mar bgrod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la brten nas gong mar bgrod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one proceeds to the higher stages in dependence on it.

original: bgrod pa dang longs spyod @271b ba'i phyir yang sa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bgrod pa dang longs spyod @271b ba'i phyir yang sa zhes bshad do //
translated: It is also explained that it is called a stage because it is traversed and enjoyed.

original: dengs khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa ni ngas khong du chud pa ji lta ba de ltar khyod kyis kyang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dengs khong du chud par bya'o zhes pa ni ngas khong du chud pa ji lta ba de ltar khyod kyis kyang khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: You should understand it as I have understood it means that just as I have understood it, so you should understand it.

original: rang gi sems ni rang gi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems ni rang gi shes pa ste /
translated: One's own mind is one's own consciousness.

original: don dang mthun pa ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: don dang mthun pa ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: In accordance with the object means correct.

original: ji lta ba bzhin zhes pa ni ji ltar gnas pa'o//
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin zhes pa ni ji ltar gnas pa'o//
translated: Just as it is means just as it exists.

original: de yongs su shes pa ni rnam par ma rig pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pa ni rnam par ma rig pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of that is not non-understanding.

original: phung po khams dang skye mched rnams la yang med pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched rnams la yang med pa ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, non-existent is because of the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pas ni bshig nas stong pa la sogs pa gsal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pas ni bshig nas stong pa la sogs pa gsal ba yang yin no //
translated: By the emptiness of intrinsic nature, destroyed means empty, and so on.

original: sems tsam du snang ba ni dgag pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: sems tsam du snang ba ni dgag pa smos pa ste /
translated: The appearance as mere mind is stated with the negation no.

original: ma yin par dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa'o //
translated: This is an external negation.

original: sems de yang cir snang zhe na /
analyzed: sems de yang cir snang zhe na /
translated: What does that mind appear as?

original: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa'i lha'i skur snang ste /
analyzed: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa'i lha'i skur snang ste /
translated: It appears as the deity's form endowed with all the characteristics.

original: thig le la sogs pa'i rnam pa las dran pa tsam mam /
analyzed: thig le la sogs pa'i rnam pa las dran pa tsam mam /
translated: From the aspect of the drop and so on, it is merely mindfulness,

original: rim gyis mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cus brgyan pa'i lha'i skur longs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rim gyis mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cus brgyan pa'i lha'i skur longs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: or it is the enjoyment of the deity's form adorned with the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks in sequence. That is what it is called.

original: de'i dpe gang zhig yin snyam pa la rmi lam la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dpe gang zhig yin snyam pa la rmi lam la sogs pa ste /
translated: What is the example of that? It is like a dream, etc.

original: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / mig yor la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla dang / mig yor la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen as having the same appearance as an illusion, a mirage, the moon in water, a magical image, etc.

original: de yang gang gi sku yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gi sku yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, whose body is that?

original: sangs rgyas kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku ste /
translated: It is the body of the nature of mind of the Buddha.

original: 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan ne med de chu zla bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa gzhan ne med de chu zla bzhin no //
translated: In this case, there is no other aspect of object and subject, like the moon in water.

original: yang dris pa brten pa'i lus ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: yang dris pa brten pa'i lus ni gzugs kyi phung po ste /
translated: Moreover, it is asked: The body of the basis is the aggregate of form.

original: de med pa ni de rnam par dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa ni de rnam par dag pa nyid do //
translated: Its non-existence is its very purity.

original: de bas na sems kyang med de nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems kyang med de nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, mind also does not exist, like a sky flower.

original: sems med na lus kyang med de /
analyzed: sems med na lus kyang med de /
translated: If mind does not exist, the body also does not exist,🔽like a seed and a sprout.

original: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no zhes lung gi tshig las gsungs pa ni bka' las bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang myu gu bzhin no zhes lung gi tshig las gsungs pa ni bka' las bshad pa'o //
translated: The statement from the scriptures is explained in the scriptures.

original: sems gcig pus lha'i sku ji ltar rdzogs par 'gyur zhes pa ni sems rdzas su med pa las lha'i rdzas rnam pa gzugs can ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems gcig pus lha'i sku ji ltar rdzogs par 'gyur zhes pa ni sems rdzas su med pa las lha'i rdzas rnam pa gzugs can ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ro //
translated: How can the divine body, which is substantial and has a form, arise from mind, which is insubstantial? It cannot!

original: 'on te lung de tshad ma ma yin na dmigs pa'i lta ba can rnams ni yod par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te lung de tshad ma ma yin na dmigs pa'i lta ba can rnams ni yod par lta ba'o //
translated: If that scripture is not valid, then the Idealists are seen to be proponents of existence.

original: lung dang rtogs pa ni lung dang rigs pa'o //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pa ni lung dang rigs pa'o //
translated: Scripture and reasoning are scripture and logic.

original: de med pa ni de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa ni de dang bral ba'o //
translated: The absence of that is freedom from that.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: yid ches par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid ches par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not have confidence.

original: nges pa'i shes pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa mi skye'o //
translated: One does not generate a definitive understanding.

original: de bas na zhes pa ni de'i phyir bshad du @272a * //🔽gsol zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes pa ni de'i phyir bshad du @272a * // gsol zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, please explain.

original: de'i lan btab pa /
analyzed: de'i lan btab pa /
translated: The reply to that:

original: mdo sde la sogs pa'i tshul la zhugs pa ni mdo sde dang rgyud dang rtog pa'i gzhung la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa'i tshul la zhugs pa ni mdo sde dang rgyud dang rtog pa'i gzhung la gnas pa'o //
translated: Engaged in the way of the sutras and so forth means abiding in the scriptures of sutra, tantra, and treatise.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i sgom pa po ni las dang po pa'i gang zag go //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i sgom pa po ni las dang po pa'i gang zag go //
translated: The meditator abiding in the stage of generation is a person who is a beginner.

original: des kyang shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: des kyang shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes sbyar ro //
translated: And by that, one will not know is to be supplied.

original: gang shes par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang shes par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What will one not know?

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i sku ni gong du bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lha'i sku ni gong du bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The body of the divine nature of mind has already been explained above.

original: gang la brten nas mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is one not to rely on?

original: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The illusory, etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni da'i phyir te gong dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni da'i phyir te gong dang 'brel to //
translated: Therefore means for that reason, and is connected with what precedes it.

original: khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba gong dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba gong dang sbyar ro //
translated: One should understand is connected with what follows.

original: gang gi rjes su 'brangs she na /
analyzed: gang gi rjes su 'brangs she na /
translated: What is one to follow?

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas zhes pa ni gang la ting nge 'dzin gtso bor ston pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas zhes pa ni gang la ting nge 'dzin gtso bor ston pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Following the Yoga Tantras is so called because it teaches the samadhi as the most important thing.

original: rjes su 'brangs pa ni de la brten pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brangs pa ni de la brten pa'o //
translated: Following means relying on that.

original: ci byed ce na rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa'i sku rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ci byed ce na rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni mtshan dang dpe byad du ldan pa'i sku rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What does one do? Vajrasattva is perfected means that the body endowed with the major and minor marks is perfected.

original: de bskyed pa'i rgyu dang de la phan pa'i rkyen ni rgyu dang rkyen no //
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i rgyu dang de la phan pa'i rkyen ni rgyu dang rkyen no //
translated: The cause that generates that and the conditions that help it are the cause and conditions.

original: de khong du chud par bya ba ni de shes par bya bas shes pa'o //
analyzed: de khong du chud par bya ba ni de shes par bya bas shes pa'o //
translated: The understanding of that is the knowledge of that.

original: de la skyu ma lta bu'i sku rgyu dang rkyen du bcas pa 'di yang ci don dam par yod pa kho na'am zhe na /
analyzed: de la skyu ma lta bu'i sku rgyu dang rkyen du bcas pa 'di yang ci don dam par yod pa kho na'am zhe na /
translated: As for this body that is like a reflection and its cause and conditions, is it only ultimately existent?

original: ma yin te yang dag par na zhes pa ni don dam par zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te yang dag par na zhes pa ni don dam par zhes pa'o //
translated: No, it is not. “ In reality” means ultimately.

original: sems ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems ni snang ba'o //
translated: The mind is the appearance.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang bral ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs med pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang bral ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs med pa'o //
translated: Free from color and shape is without color and shape.

original: nam mkha' mnyam pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mnyam pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Equal to space is like space.

original: 'o na snang ba tsam du yang med pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba tsam du yang med pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But isn’t it also not an appearance? No, it is not.

original: de lta mod kyi zhes pa ni de ltar rang bzhin med kyang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zhes pa ni de ltar rang bzhin med kyang zhes pa'o //
translated: “ However” means although it is without intrinsic nature.

original: snang ba tsam ni kun rdzob tsam du'o //
analyzed: snang ba tsam ni kun rdzob tsam du'o //
translated: The mere appearance is mere convention.

original: snang ba gsum po rlang la brten pa ni shes pa rang dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba gsum po rlang la brten pa ni shes pa rang dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The three appearances that are based on the vāyu are simultaneous with the consciousness.

original: des na / rlung gis rnam par shes pa bcings //
analyzed: des na / rlung gis rnam par shes pa bcings //
translated: Consciousness is bound by the wind.

original: zhes pa ni don phyir te gong dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don phyir te gong dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse, which is connected with the previous verse.

original: rlung gis bcings zhes pa ni rlung gis 'khyam du bcug pa nyid do //
analyzed: rlung gis bcings zhes pa ni rlung gis 'khyam du bcug pa nyid do //
translated: Bound by the wind means that consciousness is made to wander by the wind.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained.🔽The reply to the question of Mahāmaudgalyāyana

original: sman chen gyis dris pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: sman chen gyis dris pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: is stated:🔽What is the nature of the body of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa'i sku'i rang bzhin ci lags zhes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i sku'i rang bzhin ci lags zhes pa'i rnam par shes pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhe'o //
translated: What is the definition of the body of consciousness?

original: de'i lan du sman chen zhes pa ni bod pa'o//
analyzed: de'i lan du sman chen zhes pa ni bod pa'o//
translated: The reply to that is,

original: @272b sgyu ma mkhan gyi mi'i rang bzhin ni bdag gis ni sgyu ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: @272b sgyu ma mkhan gyi mi'i rang bzhin ni bdag gis ni sgyu ma byas pa'o //
translated: The nature of the man of illusion is that I have created the illusion.

original: 'di ni sgyu ma'i gzugs nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ni sgyu ma'i gzugs nyid de /
translated: This is the form of the illusion itself.

original: 'di la ni rta dang ba lang med do //
analyzed: 'di la ni rta dang ba lang med do //
translated: Here there are no horses or oxen.🔽Here there are no troops of infantry, nor tigers, lions, and so on.

original: 'di la dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / stag dang / seng ge la sogs pa med do zhes rtog gi 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs par mi rtog go //
analyzed: 'di la dpung bu chung gi tshogs dang / stag dang / seng ge la sogs pa med do zhes rtog gi 'di ni ba lang ngo zhes bya ba la sogs par mi rtog go //
translated: He thinks in this way, but he does not think, This is an ox, and so on.

original: ma'i grib mchu'i nang du byung ba yang byis pa shed ma bye ba dag ni 'di ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma'i grib mchu'i nang du byung ba yang byis pa shed ma bye ba dag ni 'di ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though it arises within the shadow of the mother's womb, the infant does not think,

original: rkang lag dang mgo la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ma yin no snyam du sems kyi /
analyzed: rkang lag dang mgo la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ma yin no snyam du sems kyi /
translated: This is my mother, because it is endowed with hands, feet, head, and so on.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni de ltar mi sems so //
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni de ltar mi sems so //
translated: But the wise and the learned do not think in that way.

original: mig dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin yang mig 'khrul pas rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba dang / nam mkha' 'o zi las sprul du snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin yang mig 'khrul pas rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba dang / nam mkha' 'o zi las sprul du snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The nature of the eye is like the sky, and the eye is seen in various forms by the delusion of the eye, and the sky is seen as a magical creation.

original: de bas na de ci 'dra ba de ltar srid pa'i rang bzhin yang 'phrul nas snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na de ci 'dra ba de ltar srid pa'i rang bzhin yang 'phrul nas snang ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, just as it is, the nature of existence is also seen as a magical creation.

original: skye ba med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni skya ba dang bral ba'i rang bzhin kho nas thog mar 'chi bas byas pa'i gzugs blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skye ba med pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni skya ba dang bral ba'i rang bzhin kho nas thog mar 'chi bas byas pa'i gzugs blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the very absence of birth means that by the very nature of being free from birth, the form created by death at the beginning should be seen.

original: gzugs rang bzhin med cing sgyu ma'i rnam pa ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rang bzhin med cing sgyu ma'i rnam pa ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Form should be seen as devoid of intrinsic nature, like an illusory appearance.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi khyad par gyi dpe yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi khyad par gyi dpe yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the example of the special form that is the nature of consciousness?

original: rtsig pa'i ri mo me long gi nang du snang ba dang 'dra ste /🔽dper na skyes bu zhig gis rtsig pa'am ras sam /🔽'jag ma la snang mdzad dam /
analyzed: rtsig pa'i ri mo me long gi nang du snang ba dang 'dra ste / dper na skyes bu zhig gis rtsig pa'am ras sam / 'jag ma la snang mdzad dam /
translated: It is like the image of a painting on a wall appearing in a mirror.🔽For example, a person makes an image of Vairocana or Akshobhya, etc.,

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs su ldan pa byas te /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs su ldan pa byas te /
translated: with color and shape on a wall, cloth, or reed.

original: de'i gzugs brnyan me long gi nang du bstan na me long gi nang du bstan pa'i gzugs de la ni kha dog med /
analyzed: de'i gzugs brnyan me long gi nang du bstan na me long gi nang du bstan pa'i gzugs de la ni kha dog med /
translated: If the reflection of that is shown in a mirror, the form shown in the mirror has no color,

original: dbyibs med / ras dang / rtsig ba dang 'jag ma med /
analyzed: dbyibs med / ras dang / rtsig ba dang 'jag ma med /
translated: no shape, no cloth, wall, or reed,

original: sa dang tshon gyi kha dog med /
analyzed: sa dang tshon gyi kha dog med /
translated: no color of earth or paint,

original: sha dang khrag dang dus pa med de /
analyzed: sha dang khrag dang dus pa med de /
translated: no flesh, blood, or bones.

original: 'on kyang gzugs dang me long gi stobs kyis ji ltar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs dang me long gi stobs kyis ji ltar yang snang ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, by the power of the form and the mirror, it appears in every way.

original: de bzhin du zhes pa ni me long gi gzugs de dang 'dra bar zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes pa ni me long gi gzugs de dang 'dra bar zhe'o //
translated: Like that means like the form in the mirror.

original: rdo rje sku'i ngo bo nyid du bdag nyid sprul te zhes pa ni rim gyis sam cig car gyis rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i rang bzhin du bdag nyid bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sku'i ngo bo nyid du bdag nyid sprul te zhes pa ni rim gyis sam cig car gyis rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i rang bzhin du bdag nyid bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having emanated oneself as the essence of the Vajra Body means that one generates oneself in the nature of the body of Vajrasattva, either gradually or instantaneously.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni rgyan cha dang kha dog la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni rgyan cha dang kha dog la sogs pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the best of all aspects means endowed with all ornaments, colors, and so forth.

original: sku lta bas chog mi shes pa skyes bu chen po'i sku @273a * //
analyzed: sku lta bas chog mi shes pa skyes bu chen po'i sku @273a * //
translated: The body that is never satisfied to look at is the body of a great being.

original: lta bas mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: lta bas mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: It is never satisfied to look at.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni lces gdong khebs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis ni lces gdong khebs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thirty-two major marks are such as the tongue that covers the face and so forth.

original: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus kyang brgyan pa ste bshad zin to //🔽de dag kyang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus kyang brgyan pa ste bshad zin to // de dag kyang gang las shes she na /
translated: Similarly, it is adorned with the eighty minor marks as explained.

original: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyud las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is asked from where are those known, it is said, in the Tantra of Vairocana's Perfect Awakening and so forth.

original: 'ja' tshon lta bu'i lus dag ni //
analyzed: 'ja' tshon lta bu'i lus dag ni //
translated: The body is like a rainbow.

original: zhes pa ni 'ja' tshon la kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dang ldan yang de nyid snang ba tsam na rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba bzhin du lha'i sku de yang snang ba tsam na rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhe'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'ja' tshon la kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa dang ldan yang de nyid snang ba tsam na rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba bzhin du lha'i sku de yang snang ba tsam na rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhe'o ;
translated: This means that just as the rainbow has colors, shapes, etc., but is free from discursive thought when it is merely seen, so also the deity's body is free from discursive thought when it is merely seen.

original: / de yang gang gi sgo nas thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / de yang gang gi sgo nas thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, by what means is it attained?

original: de nyid bsgoms pas thob par 'gyur te //
analyzed: de nyid bsgoms pas thob par 'gyur te //
translated: It is attained by meditating on that.

original: sgyu ma'i sku nyid bsgoms pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i sku nyid bsgoms pas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It is attained by meditating on the illusory body.

original: de'i rigs pa ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: de'i rigs pa ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: This reasoning is easy to understand, so it is not explained.

original: yang dris pa ;
analyzed: yang dris pa ;
translated: Again, it is asked:🔽I have some other doubts.

original: som nyi gyur pa gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang bdag la mchis zhes pa ni yid mches par gyur pa gzhan dag kyang yod ces pa'o //
analyzed: som nyi gyur pa gzhan 'ga' zhig kyang bdag la mchis zhes pa ni yid mches par gyur pa gzhan dag kyang yod ces pa'o //
translated: This means I have some other things about which I am uncertain.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: yun ring por gnyid log pa ni skad cig ma bgrang ba las 'das pa'i bar du lus sems kyis bor ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring por gnyid log pa ni skad cig ma bgrang ba las 'das pa'i bar du lus sems kyis bor ba'o //
translated: I have been asleep for a long time means that I have been abandoned by body and mind for a period of time that is beyond counting moments.

original: rmi lam du sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su phyin pa rmis pa ni rmis pa yin gyi snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam du sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas su phyin pa rmis pa ni rmis pa yin gyi snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The dream of going to the Heaven of the Thirty-three is a dream, not a vision.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas ni ri rab kyi steng gi lha'i khang pa dang rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab pa la sogs pa ni phyin par rmis pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas ni ri rab kyi steng gi lha'i khang pa dang rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab pa la sogs pa ni phyin par rmis pa'o //
translated: The Heaven of the Thirty-three is the divine palace and pond of the Slow Flowing River on top of Mount Meru.

original: yul phyogs gzhan ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul phyogs gzhan ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi gnas ma yin pa ste /
translated: The other place is not the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

original: gling gzhan dang yul khams gzhan du phyin par rmis pa'o //
analyzed: gling gzhan dang yul khams gzhan du phyin par rmis pa'o //
translated: The dream of going to another continent or another country is a dream.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ste zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nyams su myong ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong ste zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The experience of the five sense pleasures is the experience of the happiness and suffering of form and so forth.

original: yang yul 'dir 'ongs nas zhes pa ni da ltar gyi gnas 'di nyid du 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang yul 'dir 'ongs nas zhes pa ni da ltar gyi gnas 'di nyid du 'ongs pa'o //
translated: Then, having come to this place, is coming to this very present place.

original: ci'i phyir rmi lam dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni rmi lam bzang po rmis pas ni dge la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rmi lam dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni rmi lam bzang po rmis pas ni dge la /
translated: Why is it that the result of virtue and non-virtue is obtained in a dream? A good dream is virtuous.

original: ngan par rmis pas mi dge ba ci'i phyir zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: ngan par rmis pas mi dge ba ci'i phyir zhes dris pa'o //
translated: Why is it nonvirtuous to dream of evil?

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de'i lan smras pa /
analyzed: de'i lan smras pa /
translated: The reply to that is:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yul la dngos por bltas pas zhes @273b pa ni sems dran pa dang po pa'i dus nas yul la bdag dang dngos po dang rtag pa la sogs par gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yul la dngos por bltas pas zhes @273b pa ni sems dran pa dang po pa'i dus nas yul la bdag dang dngos po dang rtag pa la sogs par gdags par bya'o //
translated: Since beginningless time, by viewing objects as real entities, one should designate the object as self, real entity, permanent, and so on.

original: de yi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to dispel his doubts,

original: zhes pa ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi dgongs pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi dgongs pa bshad pa'o //
translated: this explains the intention of this very treatise.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rmi lam zhes pa ni nyon cig ces pa'i bar du ni lung bstan par dam 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam zhes pa ni nyon cig ces pa'i bar du ni lung bstan par dam 'cha' ba'o //
translated: As for dream, up to listen, this is the promise to explain.

original: phung po khams dang skye mched dbang po la sogs pa zhes pa ni phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / dbang po lnga po 'di dag ni 'du shes sbyar ro //
analyzed: phung po khams dang skye mched dbang po la sogs pa zhes pa ni phung po lnga dang / khams bco brgyad dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / dbang po lnga po 'di dag ni 'du shes sbyar ro //
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense bases, faculties, and so on, the five aggregates, eighteen elements, twelve sense bases, and five faculties, are connected with perception.

original: gar 'du shes na shes pa gnyis po ni gnyid log pa dang / ma log pa'i shes pa 'di gnyis su 'du shes pa'o //🔽stong chen gyur pas gang zhig gnyid log pa //
analyzed: gar 'du shes na shes pa gnyis po ni gnyid log pa dang / ma log pa'i shes pa 'di gnyis su 'du shes pa'o // stong chen gyur pas gang zhig gnyid log pa //
translated: If one has the idea of dance, the two consciousnesses are included in these two consciousnesses of sleep and not sleep.

original: zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ngang du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa'i ngang du'o //
translated: The one who is asleep in the great empty one means in the state of attaining appearance.

original: rlung gi shugs kyis rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni shes pa rlung la zhon nas gnas su phyin te rmi lam mthong zhe'o //🔽rmi lam sad nas bye brag gzhan med pa //
analyzed: rlung gi shugs kyis rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur zhes pa ni shes pa rlung la zhon nas gnas su phyin te rmi lam mthong zhe'o // rmi lam sad nas bye brag gzhan med pa //
translated: The one who sees dreams by the force of wind means that consciousness, riding on the wind, goes to a place and sees a dream.

original: zhes pa ni rmi lam sad nas gnyid log pa dang bye brag med do zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rmi lam sad nas gnyid log pa dang bye brag med do zhe'o //
translated: When one awakens from a dream, there is no other distinction means that when one awakens from a dream, there is no distinction between being asleep and not asleep.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: de nyid kyang lung gzhan las rgyas par bshad pa gang yong ce na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang lung gzhan las rgyas par bshad pa gang yong ce na /
translated: If one asks, How is that also explained in detail in another scripture?

original: las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, In the Sūtra of the Purification of All Karmic Obscurations, and so on.

original: dge slong zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The bhikṣus are the Tibetans.

original: ji snyam du sems zhes pa ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: ji snyam du sems zhes pa ni dri ba'o //
translated: The what do you think? is the question.

original: gnyid log pa rmi lam na kun du rtog pa'i tshe zhes pa ni sad pa'i dus bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyid log pa rmi lam na kun du rtog pa'i tshe zhes pa ni sad pa'i dus bzhin no //
translated: When you are asleep and dreaming, you imagine things.

original: 'dod chags spyod pa myong ngam zhes pa ni yul dang rdzas dang chung ma la 'dod chags spyod pa myong ngam zhes dris pa dang / myong lags so zhes pa ni lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags spyod pa myong ngam zhes pa ni yul dang rdzas dang chung ma la 'dod chags spyod pa myong ngam zhes dris pa dang / myong lags so zhes pa ni lan btab pa'o //
translated: When you are asked, “Do you experience the practice of desire?” you are asked whether you experience the practice of desire for objects, substances, and wives.🔽When you answer, “I do,” you are answering that you do experience it.

original: yang dris pa /
analyzed: yang dris pa /
translated: You are then asked,

original: sems kyi 'dod chags spyad pa de khyod kyis ma shes sam zhes pa la /
analyzed: sems kyi 'dod chags spyad pa de khyod kyis ma shes sam zhes pa la /
translated: “Do you not know that the practice of desire is mental?”

original: 'di lus kyis spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di lus kyis spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not a practice of the body,

original: yul gzhan dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan dang phrad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a matter of contact with another object.

original: de bas na de ni sems kyis myong ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na de ni sems kyis myong ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is experienced by the mind.

original: 'dod chags de ni sems tsam zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags de ni sems tsam zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Desire is just the mind.

original: myong lags so zhes pa ni de nyid kyi don rig pa'i sgo nas lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: myong lags so zhes pa ni de nyid kyi don rig pa'i sgo nas lan btab pa'o //
translated: When you answer, “I do,” you are answering in terms of the knowledge of that fact.

original: rmi lam gyi sems dang gnyid ma lag pa'i sems la tha dad pa mthong ngam zhes pa ni rmi lam dang gnyid ma log @274a * //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi sems dang gnyid ma lag pa'i sems la tha dad pa mthong ngam zhes pa ni rmi lam dang gnyid ma log @274a * //
translated: You are then asked, “Do you see any difference between the mind in a dream and the mind in the waking state?”

original: pa'i sems la tha dad pa ma yin par thugs la bzhag nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i sems la tha dad pa ma yin par thugs la bzhag nas dris pa'o //
translated: The mind of the Buddha is not different from the mind of sentient beings.

original: lan du thugs kyis dgongs pa mkhyen nas tha dad du bgyi ba cung zad kyang ma mthong lags so zhes pa ni gnyis su med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: lan du thugs kyis dgongs pa mkhyen nas tha dad du bgyi ba cung zad kyang ma mthong lags so zhes pa ni gnyis su med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: In reply, he says, “I do not see the slightest difference in their minds.” This means that they are nondual.

original: yang dris pa /
analyzed: yang dris pa /
translated: He asks again,

original: chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu zhes ngas ma bstan nam zhas pa ni ngas sngon du de ltar bshad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu zhes ngas ma bstan nam zhas pa ni ngas sngon du de ltar bshad do zhes pa'o //
translated: “Have I not taught that all phenomena are like a dream?” This means that he has previously explained it in that way.

original: de ltar legs so zhes pa ni rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar legs so zhes pa ni rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas khas blangs pa'o //
translated: “So it is” means that he accepts it by way of recollection.

original: rmi lam dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba yang gang zhig yin de nyid mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba yang gang zhig yin de nyid mi shes so zhe na /
translated: If it is said, “I do not understand what is meant by ‘like a dream,’”

original: rmi lam dang 'dra ba ni rmi lam dang dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang 'dra ba ni rmi lam dang dbyer med pa'o //
translated: “like a dream” means inseparable from a dream.

original: dbyer med pa dang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbyer med pa dang gang yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “What is that inseparability?”

original: gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: it is nonduality.

original: gnyis su med la gnyis su dbyer med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //
analyzed: gnyis su med la gnyis su dbyer med so so ma yin tha mi dad do //
translated: In nonduality, there is no duality, no division, no difference.

original: dbyer med pa ni shin tu gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbyer med pa ni shin tu gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Inseparability is complete oneness.

original: gcig pa zhes bya ba rtog pa la gcig gam //
analyzed: gcig pa zhes bya ba rtog pa la gcig gam //
translated: The so-called one is either one in thought or one in word.🔽

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa la gcig ce na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa la gcig ce na /
translated: The so-called “one” is either one in thought or one in deluded consciousness.

original: 'khrul pa la ni gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa la ni gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: Delusion is not one,

original: gnyis su brtags pa'i phyir dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su brtags pa'i phyir dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is imagined as two and because it is unconnected.

original: rtog pa la ji ltar gcig ce na /
analyzed: rtog pa la ji ltar gcig ce na /
translated: How is it one in thought?

original: 'di ltar gnyi ga sems kyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyi ga sems kyi snang ba yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, because both are appearances of mind and because they are deluded.

original: de nyid kyang gzhung 'di pa ma yin no snyam pa la yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gzhung 'di pa ma yin no snyam pa la yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thinking that this is not the position of this scripture, in order to teach that it is, he says:

original: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The Guhyasamaja, etc.

original: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: kye bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: “O Bhagavat” is an address.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar smra ba'o //
translated: “In this way” is a statement of proximity.

original: dper na zhes pa ni dpe dgod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes pa ni dpe dgod pa'o //
translated: “For example” is the setting forth of the example.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni gsang ba byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni gsang ba byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Awakening mind is the secret awakening mind.

original: de ci byed ce na /
analyzed: de ci byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung bar byed pa zhes pa ni ye shes thams cad 'di la brten nas skye zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes 'byung bar byed pa zhes pa ni ye shes thams cad 'di la brten nas skye zhe'o //
translated: The phrase “source of the pristine awareness of all tathāgatas” means that all pristine awareness arises in dependence on this.

original: yang na byang chub kyi sems ni sems can la phan par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na byang chub kyi sems ni sems can la phan par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the thought of awakening is the desire to benefit sentient beings.

original: smon pa dang 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa dang 'jug pa'o //
translated: It is aspiration and engagement.

original: lus la mi gnas ngag la mi gnas sems la mi gnas so zhes pa ni gnas par bya ba dang gnas par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la mi gnas ngag la mi gnas sems la mi gnas so zhes pa ni gnas par bya ba dang gnas par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist in the body, speech, or mind, because it is neither that which exists nor that which makes something exist.

original: 'o na khams gzhan na gnas sam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khams gzhan na gnas sam zhe na /
translated: If it does not exist in those realms, then in which realm does it exist?

original: khams gsum na me gnas te 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na mi gnas so //🔽mi gnas kyang skye ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: khams gsum na me gnas te 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams na mi gnas so // mi gnas kyang skye ba yod do zhe na /
translated: It does not exist in the three realms, that is, it does not exist in the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm.🔽If it does not exist in those realms, then does it exist in the unconditioned?

original: skye ba med de gang @274b 'phel ba med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: rtsom pa thams cad dang bral ba ni rtsom pa'i bya ba las 'das pa'o //

analyzed: rang gis rig pa ni gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de yang gang las shes she na /

original: bla ma'i kha las shes pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i kha las shes pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan las shes par mi 'gyur ram snyam pa la bla ma'i kha las bstan pa med par shes par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: go sla'o // de yang dpe las shes pa'i phyir /

analyzed: go sla'o // rigs pa 'dis zhes pa ni gtan tshigs 'dis zhes pa ste /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sgra ni don rjod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'o na de lta na ni sgra'i brjod byar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /

analyzed: de bas na sgra dang don rang gi mtshan nyid la 'brel pa yang cung zad kyang med do //

original: zhes pa ni gzhan gyi tshogs las mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhan gyi tshogs las mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: means it does not arise from the assembly of another.

original: 'o na gang @279b las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang @279b las 'byung zhe na /
translated: Well then, from what does it arise?

original: mos dang bsgoms pas rtogs 'gyur te //
analyzed: mos dang bsgoms pas rtogs 'gyur te //
translated: It is realized through interest and meditation.

original: zhes pa la mos pa ni mnyan pa dang bsam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la mos pa ni mnyan pa dang bsam pa'o //
translated: Interest is listening and reflection.

original: gang ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa 'di ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin rtse gcig pa 'di ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: Meditation is one-pointed concentration.

original: des rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni des shes par 'gyur bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni des shes par 'gyur bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Realization is the understanding that comes from that.

original: 'dis mi 'da' ba thob pas dam tshig go //
analyzed: 'dis mi 'da' ba thob pas dam tshig go //
translated: Since one attains non-transgression through that, it is a pledge.

original: de yang 'di las ma rtogs pa thabs gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: de yang 'di las ma rtogs pa thabs gzhan ni med do //
translated: Moreover, there is no other means of realization than this.

original: de nyid de nyid min spangs te //
analyzed: de nyid de nyid min spangs te //
translated: Abandoning what is real and what is not real,

original: zhes pa ni tha mal pa'i spyod pa sna tshogs pa spangs pa'o //🔽mos pa'i bsam pas nyin mtshan du //
analyzed: zhes pa ni tha mal pa'i spyod pa sna tshogs pa spangs pa'o // mos pa'i bsam pas nyin mtshan du //
translated: one abandons the various ordinary activities.🔽With the attitude of interest, day and night

original: zhes pa ni gang gis gces spras su byed pa'i bsam pas nyin dang mtshan du de kho na nyid bsgom zhes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang gis gces spras su byed pa'i bsam pas nyin dang mtshan du de kho na nyid bsgom zhes so //
translated: one meditates on reality with the attitude of cherishing it.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens through that?

original: zhi ba'i go 'phang bla na med //
analyzed: zhi ba'i go 'phang bla na med //
translated: The unsurpassed state of peace

original: ces pa ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi sku thob pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i chos kyi sku thob pa'o //
translated: is the attainment of the dharmakāya free from all conceptual thoughts.

original: mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa //
analyzed: mchog tu mya ngan las 'das pa //
translated: and the supreme nirvana.

original: zhes pa ni khyad par du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyad par du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang bral ba'o //
translated: This means that he is especially free from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de yang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba yang rkyen gang gis byas she na /
analyzed: de yang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba yang rkyen gang gis byas she na /
translated: And how does the enjoyment body and the emanation body arise from that?

original: de dang de las smon lam mthus //
analyzed: de dang de las smon lam mthus //
translated: From that and from that, through the power of vows.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi sku de las smon lam dang snying rje'i stobs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi sku de las smon lam dang snying rje'i stobs kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa la sogs pa sna tshogs su snang zhe'o //
translated: This means that from that reality body, through the power of vows and compassion, the enjoyment body and so forth appear in various ways.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The other lines are easy to understand.

original: dus ji tsam gyis 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji tsam gyis 'byung zhe na /
translated: How long does it arise?

original: skad cig thang cig tsam gyis byung ba ste //
analyzed: skad cig thang cig tsam gyis byung ba ste //
translated: It arises in an instant, in a moment.

original: zhes pa ni skad cig thang cig gis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni skad cig thang cig gis 'byung ngo //
translated: This means that it arises in an instant, in a moment.

original: byung ba ni byed ces /
analyzed: byung ba ni byed ces /
translated: Arising is the activity.

original: spro dang sdud par byed pa ste //
analyzed: spro dang sdud par byed pa ste //
translated: It expands and contracts.

original: zhes pa ni sku'i 'od zer la sogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku'i 'od zer la sogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: This means that through the power of the light rays of the body and so forth.

original: gang la snang zhe na /
analyzed: gang la snang zhe na /
translated: To whom does it appear?

original: khams gsum 'di dag thams cad la snang zhe'o ;
analyzed: khams gsum 'di dag thams cad la snang zhe'o ;
translated: It appears to all in the three realms.

original: /'di dag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: /'di dag ni bshad zin to //
translated: These have already been explained.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de lta bu'i de yang gzhung 'di pa ma yin nam snyam pa la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i de yang gzhung 'di pa ma yin nam snyam pa la /
translated: One might think that such a [buddha] is not a proponent of this scripture.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To this, [the text] says, The so-called Guhyasamaja, etc.

original: ae ma'i rdo rje ni chos kyi sku'o /🔽ae ma'o rdo rje ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ae ma'i rdo rje ni chos kyi sku'o / ae ma'o rdo rje ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The vajra of emaho is the dharmakaya.🔽The vajra of emaho is the sambhogakaya.

original: ae ma'o rdo rje bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o rdo rje bstan pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The vajra of emaho is the nirmanakaya.

original: gang du lus ngag sems med pa //
analyzed: gang du lus ngag sems med pa //
translated: Where there is no body, speech, or mind

original: zhes pa ni gang la ji ltar snang ba de la lus mi dmigs ngag mi dmigs sems mi dmigs so zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang la ji ltar snang ba de la lus mi dmigs ngag mi dmigs sems mi dmigs so zhe'o //
translated: means that in whatever appears, the body is not observed, speech is not observed, and mind is not observed.

original: sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa ston pa'i bka' de dgongs pa can yin no zhe na /🔽ma yin pa'i @280a * //
analyzed: sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa ston pa'i bka' de dgongs pa can yin no zhe na / ma yin pa'i @280a * //
translated: One might think that the statement of the emanation and enjoyment bodies is of provisional meaning.

original: phyir rje btsun gyi zhal snga nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyir rje btsun gyi zhal snga nas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this, [the text] says, The venerable one himself, etc.

original: khong stong khyod kyi lus la med //
analyzed: khong stong khyod kyi lus la med //
translated: Your body is not hollow inside, etc.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni sprul pa'i sku ni chu'i zla ba dang 'dra bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni sprul pa'i sku ni chu'i zla ba dang 'dra bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that the emanation body is like the moon in water, this is the intention.

original: dga' ba'i sems ni gzung gyur nas //
analyzed: dga' ba'i sems ni gzung gyur nas //
translated: Having taken up the mind of joy,

original: zhes pa ni sems can gyi don la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems can gyi don la dga' ba'o //
translated: This is the joy in the aims of sentient beings.

original: rdo rje'i lus ni rdo rje'i sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lus ni rdo rje'i sku'o //
translated: The vajra body is the vajra body.

original: de bsgoms pa ni rtse gcig par byed ce'o //
analyzed: de bsgoms pa ni rtse gcig par byed ce'o //
translated: Meditating on that is making it one-pointed.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: brtan lus khong stong ma yin pa //
analyzed: brtan lus khong stong ma yin pa //
translated: The firm body is not hollow.

original: zhes pa ni gzhan gyis mi shigs pa'i sku thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhan gyis mi shigs pa'i sku thob pa'o //
translated: This is the attainment of a body that is indestructible by others.

original: gzhan yang nam mkha' 'dra zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang nam mkha' 'dra zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni gong dang 'dra'o //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of “like space” and so forth is the same as above.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i mdo ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i don ston pa'i mdo ste /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i mdo ni dpa' bar 'gro ba'i don ston pa'i mdo ste /
translated: The Sūtra of the Heroic March is the sūtra that teaches the meaning of the heroic march.

original: de las kyang rgyal par gsungs so //
analyzed: de las kyang rgyal par gsungs so //
translated: It was also taught by the Victor.

original: gang gis dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa ni skyes bu gang zhig gis chos kyi sku thob pa nyid do ;
analyzed: gang gis dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'di thob pa ni skyes bu gang zhig gis chos kyi sku thob pa nyid do ;
translated: Whoever attains this samādhi of the heroic march is someone who has attained the dharmakāya.

original: / de'i yon tan gyi khyad par yang ji lta bu zhig dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: / de'i yon tan gyi khyad par yang ji lta bu zhig dang ldan zhe na /
translated: What are the special qualities that they possess?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul du mchis pa la sogs so zhes pa ni mar me mdzad la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul du mchis pa la sogs so zhes pa ni mar me mdzad la sogs pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad de /
translated: All the Buddhas and so on means that Dipankara and so on are all the Buddhas.

original: de'i yul ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de'i yul ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Their realm is the Dharma Body.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gshegs par bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gshegs par bya ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is what is to be gone to.

original: rang dbang gi ye shes ni mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rang dbang gi ye shes ni mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Self-dependent intuition is non-conceptual intuition.

original: de la dbang bgyid pa ni de la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang bgyid pa ni de la spyod pa'o //
translated: To have power over that is to have power over its functioning.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Non-abiding nirvana has already been explained.

original: the tshom gcod pa ni ngo bo dang dus la sogs pa la the tshom za ba yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: the tshom gcod pa ni ngo bo dang dus la sogs pa la the tshom za ba yongs su gcod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The cutting off of doubt is the complete cutting off of doubt about the essence, time, and so on. It is called that because it is that.

original: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa las le'u brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa las le'u brgyad pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of chapter eight of the commentary called A Lamp for the Path to Awakening.

original: // / de ltar gnyis su med pa'i rim pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar gnyis su med pa'i rim pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus extensively explained the nondual stage and so on,

original: de nas spyod pa rnam pa gsum la sogs pa ni go sla ba nyid dang / gzhung rgyas pas 'jig pa dang / slob dpon gzhan gyis kyang rgyas par bshad pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis ne ma bshad do //
analyzed: de nas spyod pa rnam pa gsum la sogs pa ni go sla ba nyid dang / gzhung rgyas pas 'jig pa dang / slob dpon gzhan gyis kyang rgyas par bshad pa nyid kyi phyir bdag gis ne ma bshad do //
translated: The three kinds of conduct and so forth are easy to understand, and because they are extensive in the scriptures and because they are explained extensively by other masters, I have not explained them.

original: gang du nyid ma'i 'od zer mun pa'i gnyen po bzhin //
analyzed: gang du nyid ma'i 'od zer mun pa'i gnyen po bzhin //
translated: Where the light rays of the mother are like the antidote to darkness,

original: shes rab kyis ni gti mug rab bsal nas //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni gti mug rab bsal nas //
translated: having thoroughly dispelled delusion with wisdom,

original: dga' ba'i stobs kyis dka' 'grel rim pa @280b brtsams /
analyzed: dga' ba'i stobs kyis dka' 'grel rim pa @280b brtsams /
translated: I composed this commentary with the strength of joy.

original: 'di la nyes gyur ci mchis bzod par gsol //
analyzed: 'di la nyes gyur ci mchis bzod par gsol //
translated: I ask for forbearance in any faults here.

original: 'dod rgyal zhags pa kun bkrol gzhung 'di las //
analyzed: 'dod rgyal zhags pa kun bkrol gzhung 'di las //
translated: From this scripture that unties the noose of chance,

original: gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci thob pa //
analyzed: gang gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci thob pa //
translated: whatever roots of virtue are obtained,

original: des ni khams gsum sems can bdag dang bcas //
analyzed: des ni khams gsum sems can bdag dang bcas //
translated: may the beings of the three realms, including myself,

original: rdo rje 'chang gi zhing du skye bar shog //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gi zhing du skye bar shog //
translated: be born in the realm of Vajradhara.

original: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma'i bshad pa shes rab mchog dang ldan pa'i slob dpon sh'akya shes gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma'i bshad pa shes rab mchog dang ldan pa'i slob dpon sh'akya shes gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The explanation of the Lamp for the Summary of Conduct composed by the master Śākyamitra endowed with supreme wisdom is complete.
